DOC.brief_summary: The multicenter study evaluates the diagnostic performance of 3.0 T contrast-enhanced whole-heart coronary MRA in patients with suspected coronary artery disease.
DOC.brief_title: Contrast-Enhanced Whole-Heart Coronary Magnetic Resonance Angiography at 3.0-T: A Multicenter Trial
DOC.detailed_description: This is a multicenter trial evaluated the diagnostic ability of 3.0 T contrast-enhanced whole-heart coronary MRA to detect significant coronary artery stenosis among patients with suspected CAD. A total of 272 patients will be prospectively enrolled from 8 cities in China.
DOC.criteria: Suspected CAD, scheduled for DSA Sinus rhythm Contraindications to MR examination: pacemaker, intraauricular implants, intracranial clips, thoracotomy, claustrophobia, orthopnea Acute coronary syndrome Atria fibrillation Coronary stents Bypass grafts Renal insufficiency (estimated glomerular filtration rate assessed by creatinine clearance <60 ml/min/1.73 m2)
